It is located in [[The Plateau]] neighbourhood of the borough of [[Le Plateau-Mont-Royal]] in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m09.htm Mont-Royal Metro Station] The station opened on October 14, 1966, as part of the original network of the metro. == Overview == The metro station, designed by Victor Prus, is a normal [[side platform]] station, built in [[tunnel]]. It has a single [[Mezzanine (architecture)|mezzanine]] at [[Transept#Other senses of the word|transept]] level, giving access to one entrance. The station's [[Work of art|artwork]] consists of 32 narrow vertical [[aluminum]] seams at platform level, with extruded square and rectangular forms in high relief. These were created by noted Quebec artist [[Charles Daudelin]].
